metadata.title: CVE-2019-11691 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when working with XMLHttpRequest(XHR) in an event loop, causing the XHR main thread to be called after ithas been freed. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR <60.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
